GeoGuessr is one of the most unexpectedly addictive geography games you can play. What starts as a simple idea‚Äîguess where you are based on a random Google Street View drop‚Äîquickly turns into a blend of detective work, world knowledge, and pure intuition.

The Steam version runs smoothly, loads quickly, and makes jumping into rounds effortless. Whether you prefer casual play, timed challenges, or competing with friends, the game offers a nice balance of accessibility and depth. There‚Äôs always that ‚Äúone more round‚Äù feeling, especially when you barely miss a perfect score.

What really makes GeoGuessr shine is how much it teaches you without trying to. You start recognizing road signs, vegetation, license plates, languages, and even soil colors from different countries. Every match feels like exploring a little corner of the planet.
It's a cool game, where you can learn a bit of geography and things about every country like: their language, buildings etc.

If you want a fully-featured game without a subscription looking over your shoulder like your mom asking why you left the fridge open, maybe wait for updates.

Early Access Game
Get instant access and start playing; get involved with this game as it develops.

Note: Games in Early Access are not complete and may or may not change further. If you are not excited to play this game in its current state, then you should wait to see if the game progresses further in development. Learn more

WHAT THE DEVELOPERS HAVE TO SAY:
Why Early Access?
‚ÄúGeoGuessr is a game best experienced with a thriving community. By launching in Early Access, we can refine the gameplay, introduce new features, and ensure the best possible experience with direct feedback from players. Our goal is to create the ultimate competitive and casual geography game, and Early Access allows us to evolve alongside our players.‚Äù
Approximately how long will this game be in Early Access?
‚ÄúWe expect to remain in Early Access for at least six months, but this may change as we develop new features and refine gameplay based on player feedback.‚Äù
How is the full version planned to differ from the Early Access version?
‚ÄúDuring Early Access, we aim to expand GeoGuessr Steam Edition with new game modes, maps, and competitive features. We plan to refine matchmaking, introduce more customization options, and enhance the overall gameplay experience with community-driven improvements. The goal is that the full version will reflect a more polished, content-rich experience based on what players love most.‚Äù
What is the current state of the Early Access version?
‚ÄúThe current Early Access version of GeoGuessr includes unlimited free Quickplay Solo Duels and Quickplay Team Duels, whereas competitive Solo Duels requires a Steam Pass. Players can compete against users from all over the world, explore diverse locations, and climb the ranks in competitive play. While the core experience is already solid, we are continuously refining mechanics, UI, and progression systems to enhance long-term engagement.‚Äù
Will the game be priced differently during and after Early Access?
‚ÄúThe price will not change for the duration of Early Access period. Nor is it likely that we will increase the price upon ending Early Access, but if we do, we‚Äôll always provide clear communication before making any changes.
Players who join during Early Access will retain access to all updates throughout development.‚Äù
How are you planning on involving the Community in your development process?
‚ÄúOur players are at the heart of GeoGuessr. We‚Äôll be actively engaging with the community on Steam discussions, Discord, and social media, gathering feedback to fine-tune gameplay, balance competitive features, and introduce new content.‚Äù

where do I even start? It‚Äôs supposed to be educational, right? Learn about the world while having fun they say. And yes, it does teach geography. I now know that Russia is really big, and yes, roads in some countries are just straight lines to infinity. Super useful knowledge if I ever‚Ä¶ get lost in Siberia.
But let‚Äôs talk about my personal experience. GeoGuessr is basically a game that turns me into a very stressed-out anthropologist. I stare at a random street corner in Kazakhstan for fifteen minutes, analyzing the power lines, the dirt, the exact angle of the sun, while my brain screams, This is literally useless information But also, I feel accomplished because, somehow, I guessed within 500 km. Victory! A small, meaningless victory, but victory nonetheless.

Now, the Americans. Oh boy. I wouldn‚Äôt recommend this to them. GeoGuessr for them should come with a warning label: Harder than Dark Souls. Prepare to cry.

Also, the irony: you learn geography but your self-esteem dies. You‚Äôre supposed to be learning, but really you‚Äôre questioning your life choices while staring at a dirt road in Mongolia, thinking, How did I end up here? How did my life bring me to this? The game is practically therapy if your therapy involves existential dread and global humiliation.
This is a good game if you have a friend to play with, but it is okay to play alone too.

GeoGuessr is one of the most frustrating and poorly designed games I have ever used. The absence of a simple one versus one mode for friends is unacceptable and shows a complete lack of understanding of what players actually want. The game presents itself as a polished product, yet it fails at one of the most basic forms of competitive play. This failure makes the entire experience feel unfinished and careless. The interface feels restrictive and outdated. Every action feels slower and more irritating than it should be. The game seems determined to prevent users from enjoying it in the way that makes the most sense. It creates needless barriers that turn what could be a fun and engaging activity into a tedious and disappointing chore. The design choices show no clear direction. Features that should be easy are buried behind confusing menus or are simply not available at all. It feels as if the creation of this game focused on everything except the actual experience of the player. There is no sense of improvement, no sense of progression, and no sense that the team behind the game understands how players interact with competitive map based challenges. The lack of meaningful updates to fix simple problems sends a clear message. The game is not built around the needs of the community. It is built around a narrow vision that ignores obvious improvements. The result is a product that looks impressive on the surface but falls apart in actual use. Using GeoGuessr for any form of direct competition with friends is an exercise in frustration. The game refuses to provide the most essential feature that would make it enjoyable. Every time you try to play with someone you know, the game works against you instead of with you. It ruins the experience and removes any excitement the game might have had. Overall, GeoGuessr feels like a wasted opportunity. It could have been a simple and enjoyable challenge between friends. Instead, it is a restrictive, stubborn, and poorly planned product that does not respect the time or expectations of its players.

‚ÄúGeoGuessr Steam Edition is a great concept: the visuals are clean, the interface is smooth, and the core idea of guessing locations around the world is still as addictive as ever. The problem is the subscription. You‚Äôre already buying the game on Steam, and then you still have to pay a recurring fee to access the full experience. That instantly kills a lot of the value. If it were a one-time purchase, this would be an easy recommendation, but with the extra subscription on top, it just feels overpriced. Fun game, bad monetization.‚Äù

Great fun with a friend, if it worked the way it should. 

1 - Constant black screens and crashes, would it not be better to use the steam version of a browser to launch google maps instead? 
2 - Arrows and clicking on road surfaces works on normal google maps, so how did you break that here? Once the click on the road will work, another time good luck you have an invisible wall in front of you and need to use an autoclicker on the arrows otherwise the holding space thingy will accidentally mark a guess on the map if you clicked in a rough area and now you have few seconds left lmao.
3 - How did you manage to make the quality so bad sometimes? No matter the graphics version you click you will have times where everything is really blurry for ages. 
4 - Achievement not unlocking or taking any progress. We got a few 5k point guesses none of which registered. I manually had to use SAM to unlock the 10 5k guesses achievements after confirming it with my friend and I am hoping to come back to a fixed game.

4 - Price lock on competetive? Seriously? 
5 - From what I see Americans, Russians and Brazillians have the attention span of a toddler. Can't understand the language? Click anywhere? This last point is just the fact we encountered so many idiots.
